Comments_List: 8 hours in practicum
10hours
it was spring internship, i had set aside specific hours to do work at the site of the internship
about 10-12
Excellent class, really informative and a huge help to completing my health policy research project!

The course is really what one makes of it based on the practicum assignment.
With regards to the class time, having some stock/frequently encountered problems to discuss might prove useful rather than having the students come up with them.

I think this was a great experience. I really appreciated the opportunity to get hands-on experience and I really liked my practicum preceptor.

I would like to make a comment about the format of the final presentations. I appreciate the rational behind splitting us into smaller groups, and I think that was a good choice because otherwise we would have had to sit through a lot of presentations, but I wish our examiner, Henry Dove, had been better prepared. He seemed not to understand the structure of the practicum and commented several times that it seemed like a waste if there wasn't a final report, even after we explained that we had written a paper about the experience and made presentations in our practicum settings. He also commented that he wished he had been given the slides in advance, which would have been possible since we submitted the slides two days before the presentation. If he had had the slides in advance, that might have made the process go more smoothly. Several times he interrupted the presenters to make comments or ask questions that he should have known the answer to based on the presentation. I felt like it detracted from my experience of my peers presenting. I did enjoy hearing about what my peers had done during the practicum.
i obtained hands on experience and learned so much from this experience
This was a great course that allowed me to explore my interests. I appreciated the format.
The practicum choices were not great, especially for master level students. This course would be great for individuals who do not have any experience but not for people who have years of experience.

Excellent program. Loved the YNHH - Office of Strategy and Management. My preceptors really cared and wanted to show me everything possible.  I felt bad because of the 1 day a week commitment, doesn't allow for continuous work on a particular project as one would hope.  It may be just the natural limitation.

The success of this course depends on the practicum placement organization and preceptor. Some placements are extremely well organized and have hosted many students so their system is seamless. Others are hosting students on the fly which makes for a challenging experience.
Great practicum experience at the Yale Clinical Optimization Services.
n/a

Strengths: good experience with real-life situations and healthcare organizations

Weaknesses: the mid-semester in-class sessions weren't very productive
Very accessible, very helpful with feedback, and overall great experience.

Dr. Klein's strength was not taking no for an answer and continuing to inspire conversation during the class time. 
The notices to remind students to post work on canvas were also a nice touch.
He was very responsive to questions and concerns. Very supportive
good
Excellent.
Marty is great - really accessible, offers sound advice and is a calming presence - good at diffusing a stressful situation with a preceptor.
Very efficient, organized and cares about the course. Receptive to feedback and genuinely interested.
n/a
Fine
Yes, it is overall a well supported practicum course.

I would recommend it, but would also like to point out that the experience varies widely. My practicum was with YCOS and it was very structured, but we also had less of an opportunity to work independently or direct the project because we were joining an existing department. I think there were pros and cons, and while I think this was a great choice for me, it is good for future students to be aware of that fact.
This is a great practicum if you're interested in health care management/policy.
i would not recommend this course to individuals with experience since the options for practicums were very basic.
Excellent.
Definitely worth looking into. Must be flexible as what you start with and what you end with may be very different.
Really enjoyed my practicum.
n/a
Required. Chances are you will spend more time doing this than class work. Highly dependent on who your preceptor is.
